questions: What happens when charcoal burns in the air ?
answers: Charcoal burns in air producing carbon dioxide, heat and light.

questions: Name different zones of a flame.
answers: Three zones of a flame are :  Non-luminous zone  Luminous zone  Dark zone.

questions: What is the composition of a match-stick ?
answers: A mixture of antimony trisulphide, potassium chlorate and white phosphorus with some glue and starch applied on the head of the match stick.
The substance that has very low ignition temperature and can easily catch fire with a flame is called inflammable substance.

questions: Who helps us when a building or an area catches fire ?
answers: Fire brigade helps to extinguish the fire in an area or a buildings.
Types of combustion :  Rapid combustion.  Spontaneous combustion.  Explosion.
The rise in temperature of the atmosphere of the Earth due to increased concentration of carbon dioxide in the air is called global warming.
The amount of heat energy produced on complete combustion of 1 kg of a fuel is called its calorific value.

questions: How is carbon monoxide gas formed ?
answers: Incomplete combustion of any fuel is responsible for the formation of carbon monoxide gas.
